snippet: President Obama’s visit drew support even from Senator Mark Pryor, who is running for re-election and has tried to distance himself from the new health care law, which is unpopular in his state.
abstract: Pres Obama visits Vilonia, Ark, in wake of tornado; was invited by Democratic Sen Mark Pryor, who is running for re-election and has tried to distance himself from the new health care law, which is unpopular in his state.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s visit drew support even from Senator Mark Pryor, who is running for re-election and has tried to distance himself from the new health care law, which is unpopular in his state.

headline.main: After Tornado, Obama Visit Puts Politics on Pause in Arkansas
headline.print_headline: After Tornado, President’s Visit Diverts Focus From Intense Politicking in Arkansas

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
